div.p:
I send you today
by Mr Waller, one
of bishop Mackenzie's
squad, 353-486 of
manuscript and
1-24 proofs.
I have made a
good many corrections
in the proofs &
several additions
more I fear than will
be profitable, but all
seem necessary -
Prof. Owen says he
will look over the
corrected proofs & so
will my friend
Mr Oswell of
Groombridge near
Tunbridge Wells,
they will I daresay
catch any thing
that may be wrong.

I send also a
picture of a man
weaving & smoking
the enormous pipe
of the country - woodcut?

The additions made
in the manuscript will
bring up the number
of pages considerably.
I spent four mortal
days in rewriting
the Victoria Falls
- I mentioned some time
ago that a bird's eye
view of them is to
be had on application
at the Geographical.
My original sketch
is not to be found
so Mr Bates says
my brother & his wife
sailed last Saturday week
for different ports. I
gave her a paper which
made the thing explicit
enough - my brother
says he wishes the
American profits alone
apart from the Â£200
or so which we might
have got from a
publisher as in the last
case - I don't know whether
he means to give that to
us in the event of his
wife being successful.

Mrs Webb has been
very ill with lumbago
but is I am thankful to
say very much better today.
I am to hold forth
